titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

publicationstmt.publisher: University of Pennsylvania, Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.repository: University of Pennsylvania, Rare Book and Manuscript Library

bioghist.p: Wilton Wallace Blancke (1884-1949) received his doctoral degree from the University of Pennsylvania in 1918 and was Professor of Latin at Central High School of Philadelphia.

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of papers by or about Wilton Blancke. Materials include: published and printed works such as Blancke's doctoral thesis, The Dramatic Values in Plautus, Guide to Hikes Along the Philadelphia Main Line, and copies of Zelosophic Magazine, Classical Bulletin, the German Quarterly, and other journals; typescript and manuscript writings by Blancke including essays on poets, music, and education, poems and comic plays; newspaper clippings about Blancke; a small section of correspondence, largely related to theatrical subjects; and notes and typescripts of lectures, articles, and public letters on education.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.
